overview: Exodus tells the story of Israel's deliverance from Egyptian slavery, God's covenant at Mount Sinai, and the construction of the tabernacle. It reveals God as both Redeemer and Lawgiver.

verses.text: God said to Moses, 'I AM WHO I AM.' And he said, 'Say this to the people of Israel: I AM has sent me to you.'
The LORD will fight for you, and you have only to be silent.
I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery. You shall have no other gods before me.
The LORD, the LORD, a God merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and abounding in steadfast love and faithfulness, keeping steadfast love for thousands, forgiving iniquity and transgression and sin.

passages.title: The Burning Bush
passages.summary: God appears to Moses in a burning bush and reveals His name 'I AM,' commissioning Moses to lead Israel out of Egypt.

passages.title: The Ten Plagues
passages.summary: God sends ten devastating plagues on Egypt, demonstrating His power over Pharaoh and Egyptian gods, culminating in the Passover.

passages.title: The Ten Commandments
passages.summary: God gives Israel the foundational moral law at Mount Sinai, establishing how to relate to God and to one another.

facts.text: The Passover lamb foreshadows Jesus—the Lamb of God whose blood causes judgment to 'pass over' believers (1 Corinthians 5:7).
The name 'Exodus' means 'going out' or 'departure' in Greek, referring to Israel's departure from Egypt.
The tabernacle contained detailed instructions spanning 13 chapters, showing God's desire to dwell among His people.
Moses spent 40 days on Mount Sinai with God—twice. The first tablets were broken; God graciously gave a second set.

figures.name: Moses
figures.description: Israel's deliverer, raised in Pharaoh's palace but called by God at 80 years old. He led Israel out of Egypt and received God's law on Mount Sinai.

figures.name: Aaron
figures.description: Moses' brother and Israel's first high priest. Though he spoke for Moses and served faithfully, he also made the golden calf during Moses' absence.

figures.name: Pharaoh
figures.description: The Egyptian king who refused to let Israel go, hardening his heart against God's commands. His stubbornness brought devastating judgment on Egypt.

figures.name: Miriam
figures.description: Moses and Aaron's sister, a prophetess who led Israel in worship after crossing the Red Sea. She watched over baby Moses in the Nile.
